info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 3:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN VALENCIA, BERNALILLO AND NORTHWESTERN TORRANCE COUNTIES THROUGH 400 PM MDT... At 330 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles east of South Valley, or 12 miles southeast of Albuquerque, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southeastern Albuquerque, Escabosa, Cedro, Ponderosa Pines, Carnuel and Miera. This includes Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 167 and 171. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches.
